III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 03/27/2024, youth ran away from the placement and has ran
away from the placement daily this week. Youth was later walking
around the placement when a staff member told him not to come
back. It is unknown where the youth is at this time.
Investigation Interviews
The telephone number to reach the Complainant plays music
without a message. I was unable to leave a message for a return
call.
I interviewed Youth A on 04/02/2024 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service Worker. Youth
A stated Wolverine Center staff attempt to redirect him when he
wants to truant. Youth A stated staff will stand in front of the door,
verbally encourage him to not truant, and hold his wrist, but not
physically manage him and he is able to leave the facility if he
chooses. Youth A stated he returns to Wolverine Center after a
truancy either on his own or with law enforcement. Youth A stated
staff complete a pat down of him to search for contraband and
often times a medical clearance is obtained from the hospital
before he is allowed to return to Wolverine Center after a truancy.
Youth A stated he has never been refused re-entry to Wolverine
Center after a truancy. Youth A stated a male staff person, who he
only saw once at Wolverine Center and does not know his name,
told him not to return if he truants. Youth A stated he truants
because the building gives him “bad vibes.” Youth A stated he
does not like the “creepy noise” the building makes when there
are strong winds.
I interviewed Staff Person 1 on 04/16/2024 by phone. Staff
Person 2 stated he never told Youth A that he could not return to
Wolverine Center if he truanted. Staff Person 1 stated he never
2

heard a staff person tell Youth A or any other youth that he may
not return to Wolverine Center if he truanted.
I interviewed Staff Person 2 on 04/16/2024 by phone. Staff
Person 2 stated he never told Youth A that he could not return to
Wolverine Center if he truanted. Staff Person 2 stated he never
heard a staff tell Youth A or any other youth that he may not return
to Wolverine Center if he truanted.
Documentation
Youth A has a pattern of truancy. Youth A truanted from Wolverine
Center on the following dates: 03/17/2024, 03/19/2024,
03/22/2024, 03/25/2024, 03/26/2024, 03/27/2024 and 03/28/2024.
Youth A returned to Wolverine Center after each truancy either on
his own or by law enforcement transportation.
Another Department of Health and Human Service Agency
completed an investigation without finding.
Analysis Youth A stated he is allowed to return to Wolverine Center after
each truancy. It is found that Wolverine Center provides for the
needs and protection of Youth A.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
